connector.description:
Send data to Amazon DynamoDB. The sent data inserts, updates, or deletes an item on the specified AWS DynamoDB table.

The basic authentication method for the AWS DynamoDB service is to specify an access key and a secret key. These parameters are optional because the Kamelet provides a default credentials provider.

If you use the default credentials provider, the DynamoDB client loads the credentials through this provider and doesn't use the basic authentication method.

This Kamelet expects a JSON-formatted body and it must include the primary key values that define the DynamoDB item. The mapping between the JSON fields and table attribute values is done by key. For example, for  '{"username":"oscerd", "city":"Rome"}' input, the Kamelet inserts or update an item in the specified AWS DynamoDB table and sets the values for the 'username' and 'city' attributes.

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.table.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.table
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.table.description: The name of the DynamoDB table.

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.accessKey.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.accessKey
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.accessKey.description: The access key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.secretKey.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.secretKey
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.secretKey.description: The secret key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.operation.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.operation
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.operation.description: The operation to perform. The options are PutItem, UpdateItem, or DeleteItem. Example: PutItem

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.writeCapacity.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.writeCapacity
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.writeCapacity.description: The provisioned throughput to reserve for writing resources to your table.

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.useDefaultCre.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.useDefaultCre.description: If true, the DynamoDB client loads credentials through a default credentials provider. If false, it uses the basic authentication method (access key and secret key).

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.uriEndpointOv.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.uriEndpointOverride
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.uriEndpointOv.description: The overriding endpoint URI. To use this option, you must also select the `overrideEndpoint` option.

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.overrideEndpo.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.overrideEndpoint
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.overrideEndpo.description: Select this option to override the endpoint URI. To use this option, you must also provide a URI for the `uriEndpointOverride` option.
